channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: K-Planes: Explicit Radiance Fields in Space, Time, and Appearance
item.description: We introduce k-planes, a white-box model for radiance fields in arbitrary dimensions.

item.title: Using a Waffle Iron for Automotive Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation of point clouds in autonomous driving datasets requires techniques that can process large numbers of points over large field of views.

item.title: WEASEL 2.0 -- A Random Dilated Dictionary Transform for Fast, Accurate and Memory Constrained Time Series Classification
item.description: Time series classification (TSC) is the task of assigning a time series to one of a set of predefined classes, usually based on a model learned from examples.

item.title: Model soups to increase inference without increasing compute time
item.description: In this paper, we compare Model Soups performances on three different models (ResNet, ViT and EfficientNet) using three Soup Recipes (Greedy Soup Sorted, Greedy Soup Random and Uniform soup) from arXiv:2203. 05482, and reproduce the results of the authors.

item.title: Constrained Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation
item.description: A potential way to address these limitations is to add constraints during learning that restrict and guide the robot's behavior during training as well as roll outs.

item.title: Model Agnostic Sample Reweighting for Out-of-Distribution Learning
item.description: The overfitting issue is addressed by considering a bilevel formulation to search for the sample reweighting, in which the generalization complexity depends on the search space of sample weights instead of the model size.

item.title: Planar Object Tracking via Weighted Optical Flow
item.description: We propose WOFT -- a novel method for planar object tracking that estimates a full 8 degrees-of-freedom pose, i. e. the homography w. r. t.

item.title: DiffMotion: Speech-Driven Gesture Synthesis Using Denoising Diffusion Model
item.description: Speech-driven gesture synthesis is a field of growing interest in virtual human creation.

item.title: LDMIC: Learning-based Distributed Multi-view Image Coding
item.description: Multi-view image compression plays a critical role in 3D-related applications.

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Distillation for Semi-Supervised Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: Given a model well-trained with a large-scale base dataset, Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning (FSCIL) aims at incrementally learning novel classes from a few labeled samples by avoiding overfitting, without catastrophically forgetting all encountered classes previously.

item.title: RD-NAS: Enhancing One-shot Supernet Ranking Ability via Ranking Distillation from Zero-cost Proxies
item.description: In this paper, we propose Ranking Distillation one-shot NAS (RD-NAS) to enhance ranking consistency, which utilizes zero-cost proxies as the cheap teacher and adopts the margin ranking loss to distill the ranking knowledge.

item.title: Data Augmentation Alone Can Improve Adversarial Training
item.description: Data augmentation, which is effective at preventing overfitting in standard training, has been observed by many previous works to be ineffective in mitigating overfitting in adversarial training.

item.title: Image Super-Resolution using Efficient Striped Window Transformer
item.description: To further exploit the potential of the transformer, we propose a novel flexible window training strategy.

item.title: Forecasting the 2016-2017 Central Apennines Earthquake Sequence with a Neural Point Process
item.description: We investigate whether these flexible point process models can be applied to short-term seismicity forecasting by extending an existing temporal neural model to the magnitude domain and we show how this model can forecast earthquakes above a target magnitude threshold.

item.title: Multimodal Interactive Lung Lesion Segmentation: A Framework for Annotating PET/CT Images based on Physiological and Anatomical Cues
item.description: Recently, deep learning enabled the accurate segmentation of various diseases in medical imaging.

item.title: Transformer-Patcher: One Mistake worth One Neuron
item.description: Our method outperforms previous fine-tuning and HyperNetwork-based methods and achieves state-of-the-art performance for Sequential Model Editing (SME).

item.title: A Simple Adaptive Unfolding Network for Hyperspectral Image Reconstruction
item.description: We present a simple, efficient, and scalable unfolding network, SAUNet, to simplify the network design with an adaptive alternate optimization framework for hyperspectral image (HSI) reconstruction.

item.title: Deep learning-based method for segmenting epithelial layer of tubules in histopathological images of testicular tissue
item.description: The pretrained ResNet-34 in the encoder and attention block suggested in the decoder result in better segmentation and generalization.

item.title: StyleGAN-T: Unlocking the Power of GANs for Fast Large-Scale Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: Text-to-image synthesis has recently seen significant progress thanks to large pretrained language models, large-scale training data, and the introduction of scalable model families such as diffusion and autoregressive models.

item.title: Optimising Event-Driven Spiking Neural Network with Regularisation and Cutoff
item.description: Two novel optimisation techniques are presented to achieve AOI-SNNs: a regularisation and a cutoff.

item.title: WDC Products: A Multi-Dimensional Entity Matching Benchmark
item.description: The difficulty of an entity matching task depends on a combination of multiple factors such as the amount of corner-case pairs, the fraction of entities in the test set that have not been seen during training, and the size of the development set.

item.title: Autoencoder-based Joint Communication and Sensing of Multiple Targets
item.description: Foremost, we develop a suitable encoding scheme for the training of the AE and for targeting a fixed false alarm rate of the target detection during training.

item.title: Maximum Mean Discrepancy Kernels for Predictive and Prognostic Modeling of Whole Slide Images
item.description: How similar are two images?

item.title: Exploring Active 3D Object Detection from a Generalization Perspective
item.description: To alleviate the high annotation cost in LiDAR-based 3D object detection, active learning is a promising solution that learns to select only a small portion of unlabeled data to annotate, without compromising model performance.

item.title: StockEmotions: Discover Investor Emotions for Financial Sentiment Analysis and Multivariate Time Series
item.description: There has been growing interest in applying NLP techniques in the financial domain, however, resources are extremely limited.

item.title: Prediction-Powered Inference
item.description: We introduce prediction-powered inference $\unicode{x2013}$ a framework for performing valid statistical inference when an experimental data set is supplemented with predictions from a machine-learning system such as AlphaFold.

item.title: Sensemaking About Contraceptive Methods Across Online Platforms
item.description: Selecting a birth control method is a complex healthcare decision.

item.title: Modeling Non-deterministic Human Behaviors in Discrete Food Choices
item.description: We establish a non-deterministic model that predicts a user's food preferences from their demographic information.

item.title: On the Expressive Power of Geometric Graph Neural Networks
item.description: The expressive power of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) has been studied extensively through the Weisfeiler-Leman (WL) graph isomorphism test.

item.title: Triplet Contrastive Learning for Unsupervised Vehicle Re-identification
item.description: For the inter-class instance, a hybrid contrastive loss (HCL) re-defines the sample correlations by approaching the positive cluster features and leaving the all negative instance features.

item.title: ddml: Double/debiased machine learning in Stata
item.description: We introduce the package ddml for Double/Debiased Machine Learning (DDML) in Stata.

item.title: Long-tail Detection with Effective Class-Margins
item.description: Large-scale object detection and instance segmentation face a severe data imbalance.

item.title: Fully transformer-based biomarker prediction from colorectal cancer histology: a large-scale multicentric study
item.description: Methods: In this study, we developed a new fully transformer-based pipeline for end-to-end biomarker prediction from pathology slides.

item.title: Efficient Training Under Limited Resources
item.description: Training time budget and size of the dataset are among the factors affecting the performance of a Deep Neural Network (DNN).

item.title: Injecting the BM25 Score as Text Improves BERT-Based Re-rankers
item.description: In this paper we propose a novel approach for combining first-stage lexical retrieval models and Transformer-based re-rankers: we inject the relevance score of the lexical model as a token in the middle of the input of the cross-encoder re-ranker.

item.title: PRIMEQA: The Prime Repository for State-of-the-Art MultilingualQuestion Answering Research and Development
item.description: The field of Question Answering (QA) has made remarkable progress in recent years, thanks to the advent of large pre-trained language models, newer realistic benchmark datasets with leaderboards, and novel algorithms for key components such as retrievers and readers.

item.title: Lexi: Self-Supervised Learning of the UI Language
item.description: Along with text, these resources include visual content such as UI screenshots and images of application icons referenced in the text.

item.title: Unsupervised Data Selection for TTS: Using Arabic Broadcast News as a Case Study
item.description: Several high-resource Text to Speech (TTS) systems currently produce natural, well-established human-like speech.

item.title: Bidirectional Propagation for Cross-Modal 3D Object Detection
item.description: Recent works have revealed the superiority of feature-level fusion for cross-modal 3D object detection, where fine-grained feature propagation from 2D image pixels to 3D LiDAR points has been widely adopted for performance improvement.

item.title: Champion Solution for the WSDM2023 Toloka VQA Challenge
item.description: In this report, we present our champion solution to the WSDM2023 Toloka Visual Question Answering (VQA) Challenge.

item.title: SPEC5G: A Dataset for 5G Cellular Network Protocol Analysis
item.description: 5G is the 5th generation cellular network protocol.

item.title: Debiasing the Cloze Task in Sequential Recommendation with Bidirectional Transformers
item.description: The most common approach to mitigating exposure bias in recommendation has been Inverse Propensity Scoring (IPS), which consists of down-weighting the interacted predictions in the loss function in proportion to their propensities of exposure, yielding a theoretically unbiased learning.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Metrics to Measure Representational Harms in Pre-Trained Language Models
item.description: Large-scale Pre-Trained Language Models (PTLMs) capture knowledge from massive human-written data which contains latent societal biases and toxic contents.

item.title: Energy Prediction using Federated Learning
item.description: In this work, we demonstrate the viability of using federated learning to successfully predict energy consumption as well as solar production for all households within a certain network using low-power and low-space consuming embedded devices.

item.title: LF-checker: Machine Learning Acceleration of Bounded Model Checking for Concurrency Verification (Competition Contribution)
item.description: We describe and evaluate LF-checker, a metaverifier tool based on machine learning.

item.title: Propagation of Linear Uncertainties through Multiline Thru-Reflect-Line Calibration
item.description: This study proposes a linear approach for propagating uncertainties in the multiline thru-reflect-line (TRL) calibration method for vector network analyzers.

item.title: Weakly-Supervised Questions for Zero-Shot Relation Extraction
item.description: Zero-Shot Relation Extraction (ZRE) is the task of Relation Extraction where the training and test sets have no shared relation types.

item.title: Adapting a Language Model While Preserving its General Knowledge
item.description: This paper shows that the existing methods are suboptimal and proposes a novel method to perform a more informed adaptation of the knowledge in the LM by (1) soft-masking the attention heads based on their importance to best preserve the general knowledge in the LM and (2) contrasting the representations of the general and the full (both general and domain knowledge) to learn an integrated representation with both general and domain-specific knowledge.

item.title: Improving Deep Regression with Ordinal Entropy
item.description: In computer vision, it is often observed that formulating regression problems as a classification task often yields better performance.

item.title: Tier Balancing: Towards Dynamic Fairness over Underlying Causal Factors
item.description: The pursuit of long-term fairness involves the interplay between decision-making and the underlying data generating process.
